titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

bioghist.p: VIREO (Visual Resources for Ornithology) is the most comprehensive bird image bank in the world. Started in 1979 to provide a centralized, well-curated collection of avian photos for scientific and public use. VIREO contains more than 130,000 images representing over 6,650 bird species from around the world. Contributors to the collection include some of the world's most talented wildlife photographers.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of photographic material and correspondence related to the VIREO database. The collection includes photographs by Harvey Fisher, Leslie Brown, and Allan Cruickshank, in a variety of formats, including film and glass negatives, color and black and white transparencies, black and white prints, and motion film (the films are housed with the Academy's A/V materials). Records in the collection consist of correspondence (1982-1987) with photographers; proposals for funding the program; documentation related to structuring information, such as classification of habitats and keyword terms; and nine accession notebooks, listing images sent to VIREO from various photographers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Crawford H. Greenewalt papers and John S. Dunning papers.
